JobTitle: Manager/Sr Manager, U.S. Merchant Marketing - Point of Purchase Product Development
JobFullDesc:
The U.S. Merchant Marketing organization falls within Global Merchant & Network Services (GMNS) and is dedicated to bringing buyers and sellers together and transforming how American Express is welcomed.  It is responsible for partnering with key stakeholders to drive profitable growth, accelerate merchant acceptance, and enhance the value of Amex acceptance to merchants and Card Members at scale. This role sits on the Point of Purchase (POP) Product Team, which leads the strategy for a multi-million dollar product set of American Express branded and Shop Small branded point-of-sale signage and supplies, delivering value to merchants and signaling acceptance to Card Members. All signage and supplies are complimentary and available to merchants via the www.americanexpress.com/signage website.
This Manager/Senior Manager will lead the strategy and transformation of the POP product set to meet the evolving needs of merchants across priority industry verticals and merchant segments.  A successful candidate will leverage internal and external insights to understand merchant’s needs and evolving payment trends (ex. Contactless and QR Code Payments) to deliver bold, innovative, value-driving point-of-sale products that merchants demand and Card Members will notice – driving spend and American Express perception of coverage. This is an exciting opportunity to think creatively, foster partnerships across American Express, and support key business initiatives.
Responsibilities:

Manage full POP product suite, including maintenance and uplift of current items, uncover product gaps for priority industries, and phase out legacy offerings based on payment trends and business direction.  
Develop tiered product offering structure, including low-cost, high-value products that can be distributed to merchants at scale across the U.S., as well premium products for targeted merchant audiences. 
Support Shop Small Year-Round heat moments and Contactless adoption with compelling product innovation.
Independently own end-to-end new product development including strategic direction, creative design, and agency and vendor coordination through go-to-market launch.   
Leverage competitive research, business stakeholder input, data, and merchant insights to drive product development strategy.  
Create marketing content and assets to support product launches (e.g. webpage banners, captivating product imagery and enticing product descriptions).
Maintain up-to-date POP Brand Guidelines to reflect the current American Express Visual Identity and ensure clear and consistent brand representation at the point-of-sale – in close partnership with the Global Advertising & Brand Management team and global POP counterparts. 
Identify product reengineering opportunities on-going to maximize the budget and repurpose savings toward new program enhancements.

Minimum Qualifications:

Highly motivated and organized self-starter who excels at working in white space, with a track record for delivering quality results
Creative thinker with intellectual curiosity and a passion for leveraging insights 
Excellent project management skills, with ability to move multiple projects forward in parallel with minimal supervision
Effective communicator and influencer with ability to structure and deliver presentations to different audiences
Strong business acumen, independent decision-making ability, and proactive problem-solving skills
Ability to be flexible and respond to changing circumstances in a fast-paced environment
Dedicated team-player with effective collaboration and partnership skills across internal and external stakeholders
5+ years of experience developing and executing winning product strategies and agency partnership experience
